summary: This document is a chain of internal emails from July 23-24, 2019, forwarding information about an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The core information, from FBI Assistant Director William F. Sweeney Jr., states Epstein was found unconscious in his cell with marks on his neck, revived but with no memory of the event, and that an investigation was initiated.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director in Charge, FBI New York Office
persons.context: Authored the forwarded email providing the factual details of the incident where Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at the MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the emails; was found unconscious in his cell at the MCC with marks on his neck, revived, and could not recall what happened.

connections.description: Sweeney, as FBI Assistant Director, is relaying investigative information about an incident involving inmate Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Found Unconscious in MCC Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center with red marks on his neck. He was revived by staff but could not recall what happened. His cellmate denied knowledge. Epstein was removed from the cell, medically evaluated, and the MCC initiated an investigation.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at the MCC with injuries (red marks on his neck).
Epstein was revived by correctional staff but had no memory of the incident that caused his unconsciousness.
Epstein's cellmate at the time claimed no knowledge of the event, stating he was listening to music on his bunk.
The MCC initiated a standard operating procedure investigation into the incident.
The Washington Post had already made an inquiry to the SDNY about the incident, indicating immediate media attention.
